entry.def: If you are downcast, you are feeling sad and without hope.

example.ex: Barbara looked increasingly downcast as defeat loomed.
example.tran: 当败象已呈时，芭芭拉看上去越来越沮丧。

entry.tran: (眼睛通常因难过或尴尬)向下看的，低垂的
entry.def: If your eyes are downcast, you are looking towards the ground, usually because you are feeling sad or embarrassed.

example.ex: She was silent, her eyes downcast.

means.word_mean: 1. a ventilation shaft through which air enters a mine

sentences.sentence: "lonely and blue in a strange city"
"depressed by the loss of his job"
"a dispirited and resigned expression on her face"

auth_sentence.content: She was a bit downcast by this chilly reception.

sentences.en: He looked so downcast I took pity on him.
sentences.cn: 他那十分沮丧的样子令我产生了怜悯。

sentences.en: With downcast eyes I explained that I was not the person they all thought I was.
sentences.cn: 我双目低垂地解释说,我并不是他们都以为的那个人。
